name: WindEurope
goal:
WindEurope is the voice of the wind industry, actively promoting the utilisation of wind power in Europe and worldwide. It has 450 members including manufacturers with a leading share of the world wind power market, component suppliers, research institutes, national wind and renewables associations, developers, electricity providers, finance and insurance companies and consultants.

WindEurope coordinates policy positions, communications, research and analysis and provides various services to support membersâ€™ requirements. WindEurope also organises high-profile industry events.

WindEurope analyses, formulates and establishes policy positions for the wind industry on key issues, cooperating with industry and research institutions on a number of market development and technology research projects.

In addition, the advocacy activities undertaken by WindEurope help create a suitable legal framework within which members can successfully develop their businesses.

WindEurope produces a large variety of information tools and manages campaigns aimed at raising awareness about the benefits of wind, dispelling the myths about wind energy and providing easy access to robust data.

WindEurope organises numerous regular events: conferences, exhibitions, seminars and workshops. These encourage the exchange of international experience on policy, finance and technical developments, and showcase the latest technology.
interests: Business and Industry, Climate Action, Competition, Energy, Environment, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Single market, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives:
WindEurope engages on all major Climate and Energy files including the ETS and the Clean Energy Package in particular Market Design, Renewable Energy and Governance.

WindEurope also engages on behalf of the sector on Research and Innovation, Competition, Trade, Environmental and Industrial policies.
